src:
Ekonomi Sulsel Tumbuh 7,2%, Ini Faktor Pemicunya
05 Nov 2019, 09:00 by Muhammad Taufiqqurahman


Kota Makassar/Foto: Noval Dhwinuari Antony-detikcom

Makassar - Perekonomian Sulawesi Selatan berdasarkan besaran Produk Domestik Regional Bruto (PDRB) atas dasar harga berlaku triwulan III-2019 tumbuh 7,21%. Pertumbuhan ini disebabkan berkembangnya semua lapangan usaha di Sulsel.Pihak Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) Sulsel dalam keterangan resminnya, Selasa (5/11/2019), menyebut pertumbuhan PDRB di triwulan ketiga ini mencapai Rp 134,02 triliun dan atas dasar harga konstan 2010 mencapai Rp 87,30 triliun."Bila dilihat dari penciptaan sumber pertumbuhan ekonomi Sulawesi Selatan Triwulan III-2019 (y-on-y), lapangan usaha Industri Pengolahan memiliki sumber pertumbuhan tertinggi sebesar 1,43%, diikuti Konstruksi sebesar 1,31%. Perdagangan Besar dan Eceran seperti reparasi mobil dan sepeda motor sebesar 1,25% serta Pertanian, Kehutanan dan Perikanan sebesar 0,72%," kata Kepala BPS Sulsel, Yos Rusdiansyah.Jika dibandingkan dengan triwulan sebelumnya di tahun yang sama, maka ekonomi Sulsel tumbuh sebesar 5,12%. Menurut Yos lapangan usaha konstruksi merupakan satu-satunya lapangan usaha yang tumbuh hingga dua digit di triwulan ini."Tingginya peningkatan produksi semen yang merupakan bahan baku Konstruksi mendorong pertumbuhan kategori ini. Serta banyaknya proyek pembangunan yang sedang berlangsung seperti pembangunan rumah sakit di Jeneponto, pemasangan tiang listrik di Luwu Timur, pengerjaan jalan tol layang Pettarani dan perluasan Bandara Internasional Sultan Hasanuddin juga mempercepat pertumbuhan Lapangan Usaha Konstruksi," terangnya.Di samping itu, peningkatan jumlah penumpang pada kategori Transportasi dan Pergudangan juga ikut meningkatkan pertumbuhan ekonomi triwulan III-2019. "Pertumbuhan terjadi pada hampir semua lapangan usaha, kecuali pengadaan air, pengadaan sampah, limbah dan daur Ulang yang mengalami penurunan sebesar 1,19% serta administrasi pemerintahan, pertahanan dan jaminan sosial wajib yang mengalami penurunan sebesar 0,01% dibandingkan triwulan sebelumnya," kata dia.Yos menambahkan pertumbuhan tertinggi dicapai oleh Konstruksi sebesar 10,05%, diikuti oleh Transportasi dan Pergudangan sebesar 6,43%, Pertambangan dan Penggalian sebesar 6,37 persen serta Industri Pengolahan sebesar 6%.Simak Video "Meriah! 1.000 Penari Ikuti Flash Mob Tari Pakarena di Pantai Losari"[Gambas:Video 20detik](fiq/hns)
text:
South Sulawesi Economy Grows 7.2%, This Is the Triggering Factor
05 Nov 2019, 09:00 by Muhammad Taufiqqurahman


Makassar City / Photo: Noval Dhwinuari Antony-detikcom

Makassar - The economy of South Sulawesi based on the amount of Gross Regional Domestic Product (GRDP) based on current prices in the third quarter of 2019 grew 7.21%. This growth is due to the development of all fields of business in South Sulawesi. The Central Statistics Agency (BPS) in South Sulawesi in its official statement, Tuesday (11/5/2019), said the GRDP growth in the third quarter reached Rp 134.02 trillion and based on 2010 constant prices reaching Rp 87.30 trillion. "When viewed from the creation of sources of economic growth in South Sulawesi in Quarter III-2019 (y-on-y), the Manufacturing Industry has the highest growth source of 1.43%, followed by Construction of 1.31% "Wholesale and retail trade such as car and motorcycle repair by 1.25% and Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries by 0.72%," said South Sulawesi BPS Head Yos Rusdiansyah. If compared to the previous quarter in the same year, the economy of South Sulawesi grew by 5.12%. According to Yos, the construction business is the only business field that has grown to double digits this quarter. "The high increase in cement production, which is the raw material for construction, is driving the growth of this category. electricity poles in East Luwu, the construction of the Pettarani overpass toll road and the expansion of Sultan Hasanuddin International Airport also accelerated the growth of the Construction Business Field, "he explained. In addition, the increase in the number of passengers in the Transportation and Warehousing category also contributed to economic growth in quarter III-2019. "Growth occurred in almost all business fields, except water supply, waste, waste and recycling which decreased by 1.19% and government administration, defense and mandatory social security which decreased by 0.01% compared to the previous quarter," he said. Yos added that the highest growth was achieved by Construction by 10.05%, followed by Transportation and Warehousing by 6.43%, Mining and Excavation by 6.37 percent and the Manufacturing Industry by 6%.
